location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.311 of 1852 from Captain Arnold Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Covering letter discussing an intelligence report received by Kemball from Hajee Yacoob, native agent at Sharjah, dated 25 August 1852. Yacoob's report is appended to Kemball's letter (f 151). In his letter Yacoob states that, in spite of the quiet appearance of affairs on the Arab coast, the sheikh of Dubai has sent a man to Muscat to seek the Imam's help in the defence of his town against its neighbours. Yacoob also states that he has received a letter from Saeed ben Tahnoon [Sa'id bin Tahnun, sheikh of Abu Dhabi] informing him that Ben Saood [Amir Faisal ibn Turki] intends to proceed to Oman after Eid.
